items.name: Are You The Brewer?
items.desc:
This is just another can of IPA. It’s also the result of hundreds of people toiling in the fields, driving hops along straight country roads, and working long shifts for the benefit of those they’ll never meet. To the many under-represented and under-celebrated, skilled field, factory and back-of-house workers, this one’s for the 99% of the industry that aren’t brewers, but are just as important. Thanks, and cheers!
6.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Back On Boogie St
items.desc:
In the early 70s, while Chuck Zimmerman was in heated discussions over the rights to Columbus, or Tomahawk (to use its trademark name), another Zimmerman by the name of Tucker released Ten Songs. Years later, in the early 2000s, by which time Columbus had firmly established itself as a favourite hop used to add backbone and bitterness to APAs and Pale Ales, Ten New Songs, a masterful album by Leonard Cohen was released.Columbus isn’t new, and may no longer occupy a prime position, but like those classic records of days gone, that don’t make it junk.

items.name: Black Is Beautiful
items.desc:
Spiced Imperial Stout made in collaboration with Rock Leopard.
This Imperial Stout is our contribution to the Black Is Beautiful initiative hosted by Weathered Souls Brewing Co and has been brewed with our friends from Rock Leopard.
It's built on the rich, decadent base from My Continuous Improvement with a complex spice profile that includes African cinchona bark, orange peel, cloves, cinnamon sticks, dandelion root, kaffir lime leaves, cardamom pods, tonka beans, birch leaves, star anise and caraway seeds.
The Black is Beautiful initiative is a collaborative effort amongst the brewing community and its customers, in an attempt to bring awareness to the injustices that many people of colour face daily. Its mission is to bridge the gap that's been around for ages and provide a platform to show that the brewing community is an inclusive place for everyone of any colour.
100% of all proceeds (not just profits) from this beer have been donated to three organisations fighting the injustices, crimes, hostility and brutality facing Black people in our country. These organisations are Kids Of Colour, Rainbow Noir, and The Racial Justice Network.
11% ABV, 440ml
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Fields Of Green
items.desc:
We'll be joined by our good mates from Verdant for our latest virtual taproom event.
Few breweries in the world, never mind the UK, have such a strong reputation for hoppy beer and we've really enjoyed watching them grow over recent years.
This event pack includes some of their most recent releases, alongside fresh beer from ourselves.
So grab yourself a pack and then join us for the event at 7.30pm on Wednesday (July 22nd), when we'll be joined by co-founder Adam Robertson.
These popular events have become a weekly feature and each week we're joined by a different brewery to talk through a stunning selection of beer, provide behind-the-scenes insight and chew the fat over the burning issues of the day.
You'll be sent details on how to join the live stream via email so keep an eye out for an email from us in case it slips into your junk folder. Don't worry, we won't be drinking all the beers during the broadcast - enjoy them all at your own pace and you'll be able to re-watch the event in your own time too.
Folks who attend our weekly virtual taproom events also get first access to our weekly new beer releases, as well as some exciting limited releases from the featured guest, before they're publicly available.
Fields Of Green Event Pack
1 x 440ml can of Verdant, Marylou 5.2% Pale Ale. Packed with flavours of peach, apricot, tangerine and white grape - MaryLou boasts a super soft mouthfeel alongside bags of juicy stone fruit and bright citrus notes..
1 x 440ml can of Verdant, Solid State, 6.5% IPA. A collaboration with Yakima Chief Hops that's jam packed with Cryo hop goodness! A creamy, tropical and punchy offering showcasing YCH’s Citra, Ekuanot and Chinook Cryo hops alongside their Mosaic and Citra T90.
1 x 440ml can of Verdant, The Importance Of Being Non-Aligned 6.5% IPA. Orange, berry and juicy pineapple radiate from this uniquely hopped IPA that closes out with a gentle hint of spice and bitterness. The first of our releases to feature the exciting new Hopsteiner’s ‘Lotus’ variety, recognisable for its tropical fruit and candied grape aromas. Comet, Apollo and El Dorado also in the mix.
1 x 440ml can of Verdant, We've Got Separate Problems, 6.5% IPA. A bold 6.5% IPA with punchy US hops layered upon a Voss yeast base that provides a citrusy tang. Expect grapefruit, freshly squeezed orange juice and pine on the palate.
1 x 440ml can of Cloudwater, Persistence Is Utile: Bitter Chocolate Edition, 12% Imperial Stout with cacao, vanilla and coffee. Take a long moment to experience our fruit-forward coffee Imperial Stout, infused with Kenyan Muchagara from our friends at Workshop Coffee and a double dose of rich, bitter chocolate. These are tough times and you deserve both a treat and a pick-me-up in one.
1 x 440ml can of Cloudwater Pale Ale, 3.7% Pale Ale. Our Pale Ale is a beer for everyday moments, whether it's conversation with friends or quiet relaxation after work, and aims to provide balance between bold flavour and easy drinkability. It's full of rounded tropical fruit flavours with a soft, juicy finish and low bitterness.
**Please note, orders placed after 9am on July 21st will not arrive in time for the live event. However, we will make events available to watch again for all those who buy the pack, so even if you do not get your beer in time for the live stream, you'll still be able to drink along later.**

items.name: I Know You Know We Know
items.desc:
**DUE TO THIS BEING A (1.5L) MAGNUM, WE CAN ONLY SAFELY DELIVER THIS TO OUR LOCAL DELIVERY ORDERS**
Enjoy the sweet indulgence of your favourite childhood confectionery. Like a gooey, fruit-centred chocolate treat, this Imperial Stout is ridiculously rich and luscious, but also full of mouthwateringly tangy fruit flavours. Brewed with our friends Three Chiefs from El Segundo, it's possibly the most deliciously decadent dark beer we've created, using an extra-long boil for serious depth of flavour, alongside additions of raspberry, cacao and rose water.

Body: Incredibly rich, smooth and sweet but with a remarkably light finish
Aftertaste: Rich dark chocolate, alongside cherry and raspberry compote

items.name: La Deuxième Saison Des Poires
items.desc:
Brewed with our friends from After The Harvest and Oliver's, this beer-perry hybrid is crisp, vibrant and thirst-quenching, finding harmony between classic perry flavours, yeast aromatics and hop notes. It was created by blending beer wort with pear juice and fermenting with a Saison yeast, before ageing in foudre for 10 months. A light Simcoe dry hop was then added prior to bottling.
ALC 5.4% VOL 750ML
Aroma & Flavour: Sweet pineapple and fresh green pear, accompanied by light lemony sourness and underpinned by light cereal malt character
Body: Light-bodied, crisp and dry with prickly carbonation
Aftertaste: Spice and doughy white bread mingle with pine and herbal hop notes
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.summary: Fresh, Funky Barrel-fermented Pale with Tropical Fruits
items.desc:
Fresh, Funky Pale Ale full of tropical fruit salad flavours.
Racked onto the remaining lees in first-use French natural red wine barrels, this Pale first developed delicate funky notes and a refreshing, dry finish. Refermentation on passion fruit, pineapple and mango created a succulent, yet zippy, tropical punch bowl of flavours. Waking up from 400 years of slumber, we can summon the energy of a great man, that had a great dream. Best served chilled, and following a period of service to others less privileged.

items.name: Ponderosa Pines On Rainier
items.desc:
Released in the early 70s, Cascade hops, named after the California to British Columbia mountain range, became a staple in new US beer styles, such as the American Pale Ale. Often overlooked by modern breweries, it’s a hop that once was, and still is, revered for its grapefruit and pine aromas. Take it on as you would a short history lesson, and though its modern setting in this beer is far removed from the original beers it took centre stage in, enjoy it as a looking-glass back into the pioneering trailblazers that came before us.
6.0% ABV 440ml
